metadata.title: CVE-2021-3875 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
vim is vulnerable to Heap-based Buffer Overflow

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3875` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm2').
